title: Gareth Bale says 'anger' will drive his performance for Wales in crucial Euro 2020 qualifier
text:
Gareth Bale has said he is playing with “anger” as he looks to lead Wales to a much-needed victory in their crucial European Championships against Slovakia on Thursday night.

Bale, who came close to leaving Real Madrid for China this summer after a public falling out with manager Zinedine Zidane, had forced his way back into his club side following an impressive run of games before he was then dropped for a Champions League match last week.

“You play with a lot of emotion,” Bale said. “Anger comes into it, of course. I am just trying to play football and enjoy it as much as I can, whether I am here or in Madrid.”

Asked if being with Wales provided him with a chance to clear his mind, Bale said: “I have not got anything to clear my mind about. I love meeting up with Wales, everybody knows that.

“It is something I have always loved doing. We have a chance to qualify for the Euros and this is a massive game. We want to get three points and put ourselves right back in the mix.”
